text: Attila Horváth (born 28 July 1967 in Szombathely) is a retired male discus thrower from Hungary, who represented his native country at two consecutive Summer Olympics (1992 and 1996). His personal best is 68.58 metres, thrown on 24 June 1994 in Budapest. He is a nine-time national champion in the men's discus event, including eight in a row (1990–1997). ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1986 |World Junior Championships |Athens, Greece |5th |58.04 m |- |1990 |European Championships |Split, Yugoslavia |8th |62.08 m |- |1991 |World Championships |Tokyo, Japan |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |65.32 m |- |1992 |Olympic Games |Barcelona, Spain |5th |62.82 m |- |1994 |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |5th |63.60 m |- |1995 |World Championships |Gothenburg, Sweden |4th |65.72 m |- |1996 |Olympic Games |Atlanta, United States |10th |62.28 m |} ==Awards== * Hungarian athlete of the Year (1): 1994 ==References== *IAAF Profile Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Hungarian male discus throwers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Hungary Category:World Athletics Championships medalists Category:Goodwill Games medalists in athletics
title: Attila Horváth (discus thrower)
